how_it_works.title: How It Works
how_it_works.p1: You can't get an SSL certificate directly for a raw IP address ‚Äî certificate authorities (including Let's Encrypt) don‚Äôt issue them. DNSBox solves this by giving you a free SSL certificate for any public IP within seconds, no domain or custom DNS required.
how_it_works.p2: We automatically inject DNS and complete ACME validation by issuing a Let's Encrypt certificate for a subdomain like 123.123.123.123.dnsbox.io. Both IPv4 and IPv6 are supported. It just works ‚Äî open HTTPS to your IP via DNSBox.

how_use.title: Use Cases
how_use.subtitle: DNSBox is a universal tool for instant access to IP addresses via DNS and HTTPS ‚Äî with zero configuration:
how_use.case1: Web development & testing: Create temporary domains for local or remote servers. Perfect for demos and testing without modifying DNS records.
how_use.case2: Internet of Things (IoT): Ensure stable access to your IoT devices in dynamic environments using persistent domain names. Simplify management and monitoring.
how_use.case3: Temporary servers: Instantly assign domain names for demo or short-term environments. No need to buy or configure domains.
how_use.case4: Enterprise deployments: Run your own DNSBox node for full control over DNS and SSL certificates. Secure your infrastructure and keep data private.

check.scenario1_desc: DNSBox automatically spins up DNS and an HTTPS proxy for your IP ‚Äî no extra setup required.

details.title: Technical Details
details.feature1: Written in Go with zero external dependencies for HTTP/DNS
details.feature2: Uses miekg/dns for the built-in DNS server
details.feature3: Built-in DNS (UDP + TCP on port 53), HTTPS (:443), and REST API (:80)
details.feature4: Single binary + systemd unit ‚Äî ideal for servers, VPS, and edge nodes
details.dns1: A / AAAA ‚Äî IP address extracted from the domain name
details.dns2: TXT ‚Äî Stores and replicates ACME challenges
details.dns3: NS, SOA, SRV ‚Äî Generated dynamically (including peer discovery)
details.dns4: CNAME, MX, TXT ‚Äî Manually set via custom_domains.txt
details.custom1: Supports adding custom A, CNAME, MX, TXT, AAAA records via custom_domains.txt
details.custom2: The file is embedded via embed.FS ‚Äî no external config management required
details.custom3: Runs in parallel with automatic IP-based generation
details.tls1: Automatic certificate issuance via Let's Encrypt using dns-01
details.tls2: TXT records are stored locally and synced across nodes via REST API
details.tls3: Certificates are encrypted between nodes using ephemeral ECDH (X25519) + AES-GCM
details.tls4: Certificates are saved in /var/lib/dnsbox/certs and validated on each request
details.ws1: Supports Connection: Upgrade and Upgrade: websocket headers
details.ws2: Compatible with any wss:// client ‚Äî browsers and CLI tools included
details.sec1: IP blocking via blacklist.txt (supports IPv4, IPv6, and CIDR ranges)
details.sec2: HTTPS and DNS responses are suppressed for blocked addresses
details.sec3: All peer-to-peer communication uses temporary keys and encrypted delivery
details.install: One-liner installation via curl | bash with systemd unit setup

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.a1: DNSBox lets you get a free SSL certificate for any IP address ‚Äî even if you don‚Äôt own a domain. Just use a subdomain like 123.123.123.123.dnsbox.io, and we‚Äôll issue and manage the certificate for you automatically.
faq.a2:
Simply replace your IP in the URL with IP.dnsbox.io. For example:
https://167.172.5.205.dnsbox.io
We‚Äôll handle the DNS and SSL setup ‚Äî you don‚Äôt need to configure anything.
faq.q3: Can I get HTTPS for an IP address without a domain?
faq.a3: Yes ‚Äî that‚Äôs exactly what DNSBox is built for. You‚Äôll get a valid SSL certificate for your IP address with no need to register or own a domain. Just use a subdomain like IP.dnsbox.io and we‚Äôll complete ACME validation via Let‚Äôs Encrypt.
faq.a4: Yes. We use Let‚Äôs Encrypt and secure all traffic with HTTPS. You can also manually verify the issued certificate at any time.
faq.a5: Yes ‚Äî it's completely free for public use, and the source code is open.
faq.q6: Which IPs does DNSBox work with?
faq.a6: It works with any public IPv4 or IPv6 address.
faq.q7: What if I have a dynamic IP?
faq.a7: You can still use DNSBox, but the certificate will only be valid for the IP used during setup. For dynamic IPs, we recommend pairing with a DDNS service.
faq.q8: How long are the certificates valid?
faq.a8: Let‚Äôs Encrypt certificates are valid for 90 days. DNSBox will automatically renew them for you.
faq.q9: Can I use DNSBox in production?
faq.a9: Absolutely. DNSBox is production-ready ‚Äî perfect for CI/CD pipelines, public APIs, SPAs, IoT deployments, or anything that needs HTTPS over an IP address.
faq.q10: Do I need to register or create an account?
faq.a10: No. DNSBox works without registration ‚Äî no account required.
faq.q11: What happens if my server is offline?
faq.a11: If your IP (e.g., *.dnsbox.io) becomes unreachable, browsers will show a connection error. DNSBox will keep the certificate active, and everything will work again once your server is back online.
faq.q12: How does IP verification work before issuing a certificate?
faq.a12: We use DNS-based validation via subdomains. DNSBox controls the dnsbox.io zone, which allows it to quickly create the required TXT records for Let‚Äôs Encrypt.
faq.q13: Can I use DNSBox with private/internal IPs (e.g., 192.168.0.1)?
faq.a13: No. DNSBox only works with publicly accessible IP addresses on the internet.
